item.title: DACO 2017 Theoretical Lecs.
item.description: This will host material for the theoretical lessons I will be teaching.

item.title: DACO - Theoretical Lecture 6a - Linear Models
item.description: Today’s lecture is split in two parts. In the first part, you will be introduced to a simple, but fundamental kind of machine learning models, Linear models. We will understand how are they formulated, and how can they be solved numerically. We will also see how can they be used for both regression and classification. The second part comprises an introduction to non-linear models, specifically to neural networks. We will continue studying neural networks in the next lecture, but this week you will already understand what are they and how can they be used for classification tasks.

item.title: DACO - Theoretical Lecture 6b - Introduction to Neural Networks
item.description: Under construction. See here for backpropagation.
